name.en: Wave Propagation I- Rock Physics Models and Numerical Simulation
name.ch: 震波傳遞I-岩石物理模式與數值模擬

goal.ch:
(1) “以最少的數學“ 描述震波在不同的岩石物理模型中的傳遞物理現象
(2) 利用選課同學自己選擇不同的 Script (matlab, python) 與 電腦語言 (Fortan, C, C++)進行震波傳遞的數值模擬
(3) 選課同學須具備任一種 Matlab, Python, Shell, GMT Scripts 或 電腦程式語言(Fortran, C, C++) 的能力
(4) 選課同學想要 學習 各種震波傳遞的數值模擬計算方法
(5) 可以針對有特定需求的同學或需要特定計算技術及其相關知識背景的學生修改課程內容來強化他／她的程式語言優化或平行化計算能力
goal.en:
(1) “Minimum Mathematical Derivations“, Emphasis on the “Physical Understanding“ of Wave Propagation Phenomena in All Types of Rock Models
(2)Types of Rock Models: Elastic/Acoustic; Visco-elasticity; Poro-elasticity; Visco-Poro-Elasticity … etc 
(3) Using Script and Programming Languages to Perform Simulations on Rock Properties and Wave Propagation Phenomena
(4) Students need to have at least some experiences on Matlab or Python or Shell or GMT scripts capability to perform the computations
(5) Students who want to learn various kind of numerical simulation methods are welcome to take this class.
(6) Can modify the class contents for those students who need specific computational technigue and its associate knowledge background

outline.ch:
授課內容在岩石物理模型 部分:
(1) Various rock physics models: Elastic; Isotropic, Heterogenous; Anisotropy; Visco-elastic; Poro-elastic; Vico-porous media
(2) Randoam Medium (RM) or Effective Medium (EM) Theories
(3) Fracture Medium (FM) will tentatively covered if time is permitted
授課內容在震波傳遞的數值模擬 部分:
(1) Finite Difference Method
(2) Finite Volume Method
(3) Pseudo-spectral Method
(4) Finite-element Method
(5) Hybrid Methods: Spectral-element (SEM) or Low-rank Spectral-Integral Methods
outline.en:
“Lecture on Rock Physics Model will cover:
(1) various rock physics models (Isotropic, Anisotropic, Visco-elastic and Poro-elastic media)
(2) Effective Medium Theories
(3) Fracture Medium will tentatively covered if time is permitted
Lecture on Numerical Simulation will cover:
(1) Finite Difference Method
(2) Finite Volume Method
(3) Pseudo-spectral Method
(4) Finite-element Method
(5) Hybrid Spectral-element or Low-rank Spectral-Integral Methods“
